- - Consultant Services Email - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Mike, Thanks so much for the update. Yes, as someone who reviews these types of contracts every day I am not surprised by this but I am sorry you have to go through it. As you know, its really important to push back on items and actually make an effort to negotiate contracts. It seems many firms can be (at best) surprised and (at worst) annoyed when they see that someone has actually taken the time to read their standard agreement and suggest changes. One of the benefits of MBO is that we help you navigate through these contracts and also end up taking on the lions share of liability when they are executed (just something to keep in mind.) With regards to your second question we do have a new private networking community entitled MBO Access <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Access_Information.pdf> which addresses many of the things you are looking for. I agree with your strategy about going after non-profits. If they want to reduce the impact on their budget but also continue to work with leading industry experts an IC /small business is a smart option and a powerful way for you to market. Thanks so much for keeping in touch and I will continue to do the same. Best of luck out there!Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> If you are in the DC area please check out our upcoming networking event! <http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07e6cqaqtk0702919f&llr=kp5x6qkab> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. From: Valerisys Consulting [mailto:michael.gallo@valerisys.com] Sent: Wednesday, October 24, 2012 1:14 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners / Mike Gallow Hi Sara,
The consulting contract got stuck. The company's proposed contract was totally lop-sided and one way to their benefit. In fact, it was not really an independent consulting contract (in my opinion). It looked more like an employment agreement that an employee of the firm would sign. I sent back a modified agreement, after consulting with a lawyer, and haven't heard back yet from them.
Thank you for keeping in touch. I appreciate learning about MBO updates. If the MBO's platform is updated to allow consultants to build a marketplace profile, I would be interested in hearing about that. I'm also on the lookout for any venues where consultants can band together to bid on projects.
I've also begun reaching out to smaller non-profit organizations to offer my budgeting and analysis skills on an ad-hoc, as-needed basis. I think many of them are going to find the environment is about to get a lot tougher in terms of executing the mission with reduced funding. I am thinking that my business development and financial analysis experience growing a professional services firm might be useful to these organizations.
Take care and keep in touch.
